8. Bibliography¶

1

Edward Aldwell, Carl Schachter, and Allen Cadwallader. Harmony and Voice Leading. Cengage Learning, 4th edition, 2010.

2

Hernandez Benavides Miguel Angel and Galpin Ixent. Exploring the musicalization of texts in Gregorian Chant using Data Analytics. Technical Report, Universitaria de Bogotá Jorge Tadeo Lozano, 2020.

3

Allen Cadwallader and David Gagné. Analysis of Tonal Music. A Schenkerian Approach. Oxford University Press, 1998.

4

Emilios Cambouropoulos. Pitch Spelling: A Computational Model. Music Perception: An Interdisciplinary Journal, 20(4):411–429, June 2003. doi:10.1525/mp.2003.20.4.411.

5

Elaine Chew and Yun-Ching Chen. Real-Time Pitch Spelling Using the Spiral Array. Computer Music Journal, 29(2):61–76, June 2005. doi:10.1162/0148926054094378.

6

Bas Cornelissen, Willem Zuidema, and John Ashley Burgoyne. Mode classification and natural units in plainchant. In Proceedings of the 21st International Society for Music Information Retrieval Conference, 869–875. Montreal, Canada, October 2020. ISMIR. doi:10.5281/zenodo.4245572.

7

Dimitrios S. Delviniotis. New Method of Byzantine Music (BM) Intervals' Measuring and Its Application in the Fourth Mode. $A$ New Approach of the Music Intervals' Definition. Series Musicologica Balcanica, 1(2):209–232, February 2021. doi:10.26262/smb.v1i2.7941.

8

Vedad FamourZadeh. La musique persane, Formalisation algébrique des structures. Technical Report, IRCAM, 2005.

9

Allen Forte. The Structure of Atonal Music. Yale University Press, New Haven and London, 1977.

10

Dora A Hanninen. Orientations, Criteria, Segments: A General Theory of Segmentation for Music Analysis. Journal of Music Theory, 45(2):345–433, 2001.

11

Dora A. Hanninen. A Theory of Music Analysis: On Segmentation and Associative Organization. University of Rochester Press, Rochester, NY, first edition, December 2012.

12

Daniel Harasim, Fabian C. Moss, Matthias Ramirez, and Martin Rohrmeier. Exploring the foundations of tonality: statistical cognitive modeling of modes in the history of Western classical music. Humanities and Social Sciences Communications, 8(1):1–11, January 2021. doi:10.1057/s41599-020-00678-6.

13

M Kemal Karaosmanoğlu. A Turkish Makam Music Symbolic Database for Music Information Retrieval: SymbTr. In ISMIR, 6. 2012.

14

David Lewin. Generalized Musical Intervals and Transformations. Oxford University Press, Oxford, 1987.

15

Robert Lieck and Martin Rohrmeier. Modelling Hierarchical Key Structure with Pitch Scapes. In Proceedings of the 21st International Society for Music Information Retrieval Conference (ISMIR 2020), 811–818. Montreal, Canada, 2020. doi:10.5281/zenodo.4245558.

16

David Meredith. The ps13 pitch spelling algorithm. Journal of New Music Research, 35(2):121–159, June 2006. doi:10.1080/09298210600834961.

17

David Meredith and Geraint A Wiggins. Comparing Pitch Spelling Algorithms. Proceedings of the International Symposium on Music Information Retrieval (ISMIR), pages 280–287, 2005. doi:10.1007/978-3-540-31807-1_14.

18

Fabian C. Moss, Markus Neuwirth, Daniel Harasim, and Martin Rohrmeier. Statistical characteristics of tonal harmony: a corpus study of Beethoven's string quartets. PLoS ONE, 14(6):e0217242, 2019. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0217242.

19

Meinhard Müller. Fundamentals of Music Processing. Springer, 2015.

20

Markus Neuwirth, Daniel Harasim, Fabian C. Moss, and Martin Rohrmeier. The Annotated Beethoven Corpus (ABC): A Dataset of Harmonic Analyses of All Beethoven String Quartets. Frontiers in Digital Humanities, 5(July):1–5, 2018. doi:10.3389/fdigh.2018.00016.

21

Edward Nowacki. Latin and Greek Music Theory. Eastman Studies in Music. University of Rochester Press, Rochester, 2020.

22

Thomas Nuttall, Miguel G. Casado, Andres Ferraro, Darrell Conklin, and Rafael Caro Repetto. A computational exploration of melodic patterns in Arab-Andalusian music. Journal of Mathematics and Music, 0(0):1–13, May 2021. doi:10.1080/17459737.2021.1917010.

23

Richard Parncutt. Pitch-class prevalence in plainchant, scale-degree consonance, and the origin of the rising leading tone. Journal of New Music Research, 48(5):434–448, October 2019. doi:10.1080/09298215.2019.1642360.

24

Farshad Sanati. An Investigation on the Value of Intervals in Persian Music. Master Thesis, University of Jyväskylä, 2020.

25

Craig Stuart Sapp. Harmonic Visualizations of Tonal Music. In The International Computer Music Conference (ICMC), 423–430. 2001.

26

Craig Stuart Sapp. Visual hierarchical key analysis. Computers in Entertainment, 3(4):3, 2005. doi:10.1145/1095534.1095544.

27

Joshua Stoddard, Christopher Raphael, and Paul E Utgoff. Well-tempered spelling: A key-invariant pitch spelling algorithm. In Proceedings of the 5th International Conference on Music Information Retrieval (ISMIR 2004). Barcelona, Spain, 2004.

28

Joseph Nathan Straus. Introduction to post-tonal theory. Pearson Prentice Hall, New York, 3rd edition, 2005.

29

David Temperley. The Cognition of Basic Musical Structures. MIT Press, 2001.

30

Cédric Viaccoz, Daniel Harasim, Fabian C. Moss, and Martin Rohrmeier. Wavescapes: A Visual Hierarchical Analysis of Tonality using the Discrete Fourier Transformation. Musicae Scientiae, 2021.

31

Frans Wiering. The Language of the Modes: Studies in the History of Polyphonic Modality. Routledge, New York and London, 2001.
